Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Zabul

texts.en:
Zabul is 53 years old and is married with three children. Zabul is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli town who now lives in the Absheron region with his wife and children. 

Zabul has a store with name of "1001 Xirdavat" where he sells general products. He needs a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to expand his store in order to stock more products. He has run this general store for 3 years and must increase his monthly income to support his big family.

loans.use: to expand his store

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, a married mother of two children, works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from video games. Mary Ann is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, and soft drinks to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has continued her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Precie

texts.en:
Precie is a 32-year-old married woman with three school-age children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Precie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 23000 PHP through NWTF to buy boxes of fresh fish to sell at the fresh food market.

Precie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Precie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is 45 years old and lives in the Samburu village in the coastal region with his wife, mother and seven children. 

Tsuma buys goats for fattening then resells. He provides goat meat to local butchers. Tsuma has 4 years of experience in this field. Selling goat meat products to local markets helps Tsuma earn a monthly income. Unfortunately, it is not enough to cover his big family’s everyday costs. So, Tsuma has applied for this loan. 

With the loan proceeds, he would purchase 5 goats. He will raise and fatten them for five to six months and resell them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar. This will significantly increase Tsuma’s income and will enable him to ensure a better future for his seven children.

loans.use: to purchase 5 goats.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old and lives with her husband and six children. She raises goats for resale. This is a family business and she has her own land with plenty of green pastures for her livestock. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy two goats that will increase her volume of livestock. In the future this will increase her income. Her goal is to grow her business and profits to provide some of her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy goats for resell.

loans.name: Medude

texts.en: Medude is taking another loan of 30,000 KES to boost her grocery store business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more provisions and food. She dreams of expanding to meet her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and food.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

Liezl requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima is taking out another Kiva loan of 80,000 KES to boost her general store business because she anticipates an increase in demand during the holiday season. She wants to use the loan to purchase soap, milk, and spaghetti to sell. She dreams of taking her business to greater heights.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, and spaghetti to sell

loans.name: Njeni

texts.en:
Njeni is a 50-year-old widowed woman. For the past two years, Njeni has been selling fruits and vegetables. She has a good reputation among her customers and is known for selling fresh fruits and vegetables. Her business has been profitable. It is her only source of income, and sometimes she needs support to cover part of her costs.

Njeni is requesting a loan to buy a large variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. This will enable her to meet her customers' demands and satisfy their needs, which will improve sales and increase Njeni's income.

The photo above shows Njeni inside her store.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is taking another loan of 50,000 KES to boost her business. She wants to purchase shop items like sugar, frying fats, and maize flour. 

She dreams of expanding her business to meet her basic family needs. Mbeyu is grateful for Kiva lenders for the support which has enabled her to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase shop items like sugar, frying fats, maize, and flour.

loans.name: Shallet

texts.en:
Shallet is a single woman. Although she was never able to finish high school, Shallet trained as a seamstress and designer. For years she worked at a seamstress shop, but when the shop closed, she could find only a part-time position somewhere else. She decided to take this as an opportunity to begin working from home. She now manages her business and continues to work part time. She provides seamstress and tailoring services, designs clothes, and makes specialty items on demand.

Shallet needs this loan to purchase two specialized professional sewing machines, cloth, and materials. Shallet wants to continue to develop her business. She wants to expand into designing evening and wedding gowns and to grow her business enough to hire staff.

loans.use: to purchase two specialized professional sewing machines, cloth, and materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her food market business. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, millet and sugar to resell, and will help her to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. Margaret hopes that, in the future, she will be able to create another business in town.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, millet and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: Gabil, 30 years old, is married and has three children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli, now living with his family in Bala-Bahmanli village in the Fuzuli region. Gabil has operated an electrical goods sales  business for 2 years, selling everything for electrical use in his shop. Gabil must increase his monthly income to support his big family. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and lives in the town of Samburu. She has seven children, all of whom graduated from school. For the past 10 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, salt and cooking oil.

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers. This loan will help Mary to generate greater profits and to pay her children's school fees and medical bills. Mary hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a big commercial house.

Mary is a member of Yehu Microfinance Trust. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities to attract more customers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow and the mother of five children. In 2002, she opened her own grocery store to help her husband make their living. Fatuma is a hard worker with a very good reputation. 

Today, Fatuma is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Yehu. She wants to buy new merchandise for her business, in order to increase the variety of products she sells. Fatuma is always responsive to her customers' requests in order to keep them loyal and pleased. She hopes to turn her shop into a supermarket and she is willing to open a bakery in the future.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise in order to increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 40 years old. He is married and has three children. Ali is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fizuli. Now, he lives in the Fizuli region, in the Kurdmahmudlu village, with his family. He must increase his monthly income to support his big family. Ali needs a loan of 2,300 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN) to buy calves to improve his business. Ali has been engaged in the agriculture business raising cows for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Alison

texts.en:
Alison founded Lipstick Prophets, Inc. in February 2006 as a wholesale clothing manufacturer.  Her products include denim and woven ready-to-wear clothing, loungewear, handbags, footwear and jewelry.  Most of Lipstick Prophets sales come through their website but Alison is also now distributing her products to several top chain stores. 

Alison is seeking a loan of $10,000 to purchase additional sewing machines to help her meet the increasing product demand.  She will also be creating two new jobs.

loans.use: To purchase additional sewing machines

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en: Mnyazi is taking out another loan of KES 40,000 to diversify her business; she wants to establish another business selling charcoal. Mnyazi will use this loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika lives in the coastal region of Samburu. She is 21 years old and married and has three children. Her children attend school.

Masika has been engaged in raising livestock for two years already. She wants to expand the number of her goats and is taking a loan to buy goats for fattening and then reselling.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Peshency

texts.en: Peshency is taking out another Kiva loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to boost her cafe business and add a kiosk business of selling household consumables. With the loan, she plans to purchase food products to sell. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en: Tsuma wants to boost his tailoring shop and has asked Kiva's partner Yehu for this loan in order to buy a sewing machine. Tsuma hopes that this loan will help him increase productivity and thus improve his income so that he achieves his dream of owning a costume factory.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. She is aware that the forthcoming festive season is around the corner and she wants to take advantage of this since it is the time when sales are high. Mwanakombo is grateful for the support she was offered in the previous loan because it helped her to settle her orders. She intends to use this loan to buy more fabrics, zippers and other sewing materials to make more garments to fill her current orders. Mwanakombo is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, zippers and other sewing materials

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar, 47 years old, is married and has 4 children. Yashar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town who now lives in the Fizuli region with his family. Yashar has been in the taxi business for 7 years. In the photo, one can see the iron equipment on Yashar's taxi, which he uses to transport goods. He explains that he must increase his monthly income to support his big family. As a result, Yashar is seeking a loan of 2,000 AZN to to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to boost her retail shop business as she anticipates an increase in demand during the Christmas holidays. She wants to use the loan to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities to attract more customers.

loans.name: Ng'ombo

texts.en: N'gombo would like to use this loan to purchase clothes at wholesale prices so that he can resell them in his district for a profit. It will be hard work for N'gombo but he expects to use the loan proceeds to make his business more profitable and to increase his family's income. N'gombo will reinvest the profits back into his clothing sales business so that he can increase his inventory and sales volume. As a result, he believes that his family will have more funds to satisfy their living expenses and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Issac

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Issac. He is a single man and lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

In 2010, Issac established a general store, selling drinks, wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. He began his business so that he could be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are men and women of all ages. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Issac requires a new loan in order to buy additional inventory for his store. He hopes that this loan will improve his stock. In the future, Issac plans to improve his business by opening another shop on the outskirts of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory for his general store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 35 years old. She is a young person of low income. She has five dependent children. She sells greens and a variety of vegetables from a small stall in the central market in Mwambalazi. She has a variety of customers and her workday starts at 8.00 AM. She finishes work at 6:30 PM. Fatuma’s daily routine is very tiring. She works hard every day so that she can have a better future. She wants to have more customers from the town, but she needs a little money to buy vegetables and grocery items so she can sell them from her small stall and have better earnings. This is what she most needs in order to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grocery items

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is married and lives with her husband and three children. Her children attend school.

Teresia relates that, in order to start her business, she had to go to college. It was there that she learned the dressmaker trade, working as a seamstress in a factory producing windcheater jackets. She was able to save money over the years, and as a result, with her savings she bought a sewing machine and started her business. At the present time, she is one of the best known people for sewing articles of clothing, jackets, curtains, sheets etc.

The loan that Teresia has applied for is intended to purchase fabrics and other articles to be able to satisfy her customer’s wishes. In this way, she intends to offer them better and faster service.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and other tailoring items

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 37 years old. He is married and has three children. Elnur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his wife and children. He has had a general store for five years. In his store, he sells spare parts, electronics, etc. He must increase his monthly income to support his family. Now he needs 2,000 AZN to buy goods for his store to improve his business. Elnur loves his family.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children between the ages of 11 and 3 years old. She owns a tailoring shop in the Samburu area where her business has been in operation for over 2 years, earning her a monthly income.

She is requesting her second term loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Yehu, and she intends to purchase textile materials of different textures to make clothes for resale. The profits she earns will be used to educate her children who are in school and to add more stock to her business.

She hopes to educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials of different textures to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 38-year-old married father living in Samburu. He started out with a retail shop and got capital to start a clothing shop seven years ago. Hassan's main business challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs and seasonal customers. His personal goals are to educate his children and to buy a car. Hassan needs this loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Musyimi

texts.en: Musyimi has been running a retail shop for several years. He is a humble person who is liked by many. He is requesting a new loan to invest in the current business. He wants to restock his store, since his inventory has gone down. He does not want to lack the basic needs that his customers ask for on a daily basis. Musyimi will buy stock of flour, basic grains, cooking oils and fats, snacks, and soft drinks, among other goodies.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, basic grains, cooking oils and fats, snacks, and soft drinks, among other goodies.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is taking out another Kiva loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to increase her stock. She anticipates an increase in demand during this festive season. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish and green vegetables for resale. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dried fish and green vegetables.

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en:
Merashid lives in the town of Samburu, in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 15 years, Merashid has been working hard to manage her mat-weaving business and livestock business, which includes the fattening of goats for resale.

To help expand her business, Merashid has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). The loan will be used to buy more goats for resale. The increase will help Merashid to generate greater profits, enabling her to improve her family's standard of living and pay for her medical bills. Merashid hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have the best goat breeds in the whole village.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a young man who needs to generate income to support his wife who is still childless. He lives in the rural part of Mwambalazi. For over five years, he has been running a retail shop, which he says is doing well. Rajab gets up at 6:00 a.m. to open his store because that is when his bread suppliers deliver to him. From then on, he serves his customers. All day, he serves his neighbors and other people who need to purchase items at the store.

Rajab needs the loan to stock his business, since, at times, he lacks operating capital and the store is under stocked. He dreams of having a bigger store someday.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour, rice, beans, and instant goods.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married and has three children, two girls and a boy.

In 2008, Mwanahamisi established her provisions and drinks business. She began her business because she was unable to further her education and needed a source of living. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) every month from this business.

Mwanahamisi would like a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES. She requires this loan in order to buy more provisions wholesale at a reduced rate. In the future, Mwanahamisi plans to expand her business and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en: Lozi is a married woman. She owns a grocery shop in her area and sells basic food items such as rice and oil. The revenue generated by her business enables her to meet her family needs and those of her five children. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES so that she can buy rice, oil and other products. Her ambition is to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other products.

loans.name: Nimudzo

texts.en:
Nimudzo is a married woman with six children, who has been working in her own grocery store for the past 20 years. She likes her work and puts much effort into improving it and expanding it as much as she can. Nimudzo is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Yehu in order to increase her merchandise with newly released goods and special-offer products that will increase her income and improve her standard of living.

Nimudzo is well known in the region, with her good reputation and special customer service. That's why she puts so much effort into pleasing her customers.

She hopes that one day she will be able to expand her small shop into a large supermarket.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released goods and special-offer products that will increase her income.

loans.name: Jego

texts.en:
Jego owns a grocery store and it is the only source of income to help him subsist. For that reason, the sole means of improving his quality of life is to resupply his small grocery store. Since it is in a strategic location, he can count on an elevated demand for what he stocks.

Jego needs to request a loan to be able to improve his business. He is a very enterprising person who wants people to have confidence in him and he wishes to demonstrate that he can respond in a responsible way.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cleaning products, drinks, breads, etc to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
One of Susana' most important dreams is her motivation to succeed. She lives with her family in a home of her own and wants to have a new beginning and leave behind the crime that surrounds her. She feels that this is one of the best decisions she has made and she is proud of that. 

Susana has a small store where she sells primary needs products such as basic grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, and other things. She has done this for some time and has many customers who prefer her because of her products’ quality, her good prices, and the excellent service she provides. Other sources of income include farming.

She is an active, entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work and with many goals that she wants to meet. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and feels satisfied with the business. Demand has increased in the recent weeks and she wants to make a new investment, so she is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, etc. She has many payment references and is very responsible. She is certain that she will be able to get out of debt and keep her household finances secure.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, etc. for her store

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: For the last 15 years, Jumwa has been engaged in animal sales. She sells goats at the market. It is a business that has sustained her family and enabled her to educate her children. She is a married woman with seven children. She says that thanks to her children and husband who are very supportive, she goes to her farm during her free time. Jumwa wants to have more goats to sell, especially this festive season where sales are high. She will buy 10 goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy 10 goats to sell

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en: Chinyavu is a married woman and the mother of five children, all of whom are attending a local school. She is a dedicated mother who does not fear any challenge and is very ready to face any adversity that comes. She has been operating a meat-goat business for the last ten years, selling at the market. She does this so that her family can have a decent life. She is asking for loan to boost her working capital so that she can buy more goats to sell during the Christmas and new year festives. She is a responsible person who is sure to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Fateh

texts.en:
Fateh is a 28-year-old married man with one child who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has a diploma and has been running a small water desalination station. He is very hard-working and he has been doing this work for two years. His business is easily accessible for his customers and this means it is much frequented. Thanks to the earnings he receives, he has been able to provide for his family's needs. 

Fateh is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 Yemeni rial to buy supplies, such as bottles, for distributing water to his customers. He hopes to own another water desalination station and own a car.

loans.use: to buy supplies like bottles for distributing water to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Wilebaldo

texts.en:
Wilebaldo (pictured with his wife and their daughter), a Tlaxcalan dairy farmer, is looking to improve profits. He has invested in a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because it will allow him to both reduce costs and add value to his products. Using the cow manure from his dairy cows, the system will generate high-quality fertilizer, allowing Wilebaldo to dramatically reduce his spending on agrochemical fertilizer. The system will also generate renewable biogas, allowing Wilebaldo to decrease his spending on the expensive, non-renewable LP gas he currently uses to produce cheese and yogurt, products which fetch a higher price in the market than milk. 

Moreover, Wilebaldo and his family, considered innovators in their community, are also moved by the importance of trying to reduce their farm's impact on the environment. This loan represents 33% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Thlothia Group

texts.en: This group is called Thlothia. It consists of seven ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Thlothia is 41 years old and a widow working in a clean environment as a cleaner of general roads. She is a hardworking woman. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil, cooking oil and Maggi for resale.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Iye. She is married and has three children, aged 17, 14 and 8. In 1994, Iye established her grocery shop/provisions business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are the general community people. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Le. Iye requires a loan in order to purchase more provision items for resale. In the future, Iye plans to educate her children to university and to become a wholesale supplier. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provision items for resale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and has one child who is in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, etc..

Rowena has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. In the photo, you see Rowena with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 56 years old and two of her children are in school.

Dolores has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for tailoring like a tape measure, fabric, needles, etc..

Dolores has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring like tape measure, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is a widow and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 13500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell like apples, mangoes, oranges, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell like apples, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milk and mayonnaise for her business.

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is 36 years old, married and has 3 children who are in school.

Nove is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nove requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nove has been raising pigs for 17 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nove would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 63 years old, and is a widow with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Verginia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Verginia requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fruits to sell.

Verginia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Verginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fruits to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her shop.

Imelda has been in this business for 23 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Yolanda has been pig fattening for 12 years and earns additional income from meat vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
Regalado works hard to support her family. Regalado is married and has a watch repair business in the Philippines.

Regalado requested an 18,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

Regalado has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Regalado would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and equipment for her watch-repair business.

loans.name: Abdelkareem

texts.en:
AbdelKareem is a 35-year-old married man with no children yet. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs.

For the past two years, AbdelKareem has also been a taxi driver, which has been a profitable project and a second, helpful source of income to him, but also it needs some support to cover the costs.

AbdelKareem is requesting a $1,500 loan from FATEN to cover the cost of making some necessary repairs to the taxi he drives, such as painting and changing the wheels and mirrors. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable AbdelKareem to work extra hours and increase his income positively, which will offer to him and his wife better living conditions.

AbdelKareem is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair the taxi.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 20-year-old Aminata. She is married and has one child, aged 1. In 2006, Aminata established her "junks" (used clothing) business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are low-income earners. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Le. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy big bundles of second-hand clothing for resale. In the future, Aminata plans to build a house and establish another business outlet in the city. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy big bundles of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: This is 22-year-old Mariatu. She is a divorcee and has no children. In 2011, Mariatu established her Building Materials & Electrical Appliances business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her livelihood. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are contractors and men. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails and paints for resale. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house and establish another business outlet in the city. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron rods, nails and paints

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is photographed next to the rickshaw he owns.

Majdi is a 44-year-old married man and a father to three sons and two daughters.

For the past three years, Majdi has been a rickshaw driver, which is the only source of income to him and his family.

Majdi wants to improve and expand his work as a rickshaw driver and use the rickshaw not only for transferring customers but also to transfer goods from one area to another.

Majdi is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing and installing a trailer to the rickshaw he drives. Taking this loan will create for Majdi another new path in his work, which will enable him to work extra hours and take additional requests, which will increase his income and improve the family's living conditions for the better.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a trailer for the rickshaw.

loans.name: Al-Drahma Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Drahma. It consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. This group is hardworking. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Aisha is 22 years old. She is a single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use for her home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.name: Najom Group

texts.en:
This group is called Najom. It consists of six ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Azizh is 29 years old. She is the leader of this group and works hard to offer a good life to her family. She has six children who live in Taiz. 

She owns a house and intends to renew it, so she applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken inside their house.

Eman is a 26-year-old married young woman with no children yet. Eman and her husband are nurses at a local hospital, and both are getting low salaries which are not enough to cover all their needs.

Eman has a problem in her house. Especially in the winter season, the house ceiling is leaking water and this has led to damage to the house and its furniture.  Eman wants to repair the leaking water problem at her house especially now that it is the winter season, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing the necessary materials and hiring workers. Taking this loan will fix their house's ceiling leaks and offer to Eman and her husband healthy and suitable home conditions, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys, all of whom are attending school. She established a business selling cooked fast foods. She began her business in order to be self-reliant. It is located in the city center and her main customers are adults of both sexes. She works 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. 

Njira has requested for loan of KSH 30,000 to increase her stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and cooking fat oil. She hopes that this loan can help her improve her business and add to her profits. In the future, she plans to establish a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en: Kanga is taking another loan of KES 15,000 to boost her clothes-selling business as she anticipates an increase in demand for clothes during the Christmas holiday season. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and khangas. She gives thanks to Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and khangas

loans.name: Lucenda

texts.en:
Lucenda works hard to support her family. Lucenda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lucenda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fish to sell.

Lucenda has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Lucenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with four children. She owns a retail shop that is stocked mainly with maize and wheat floor. She is a hardworking businesswoman who leaves no stone unturned. This has helped her to gain a wide variety of customers in the field.

Luvuno, though undergoing a lot of challenges, has decided to expand her business  It is for this reason that she has decided to request a loan of KSH 10,000 to add more maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a single mother of seven children, a resident of Tiribe, Kenya. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mwanarusi operates a retail shop. She sells house consumables like maize flour and wheat flour in the community market. She buys a quantity of stock and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 Kenyan Shilling loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is married with five children that he is responsible for. He is originally from Mombasa, Kenya. He is characterized as a hardworking and responsible person with a desire for personal improvement. He has a business selling household consumables and has been in this business for 2 years. He has therefore demonstrated his responsibility in paying on time and in the right manner. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and supply his business with consumables such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, coconut, toothpaste, corn, and wheat. Omar is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources.

loans.use: to purchase consumables such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, coconut, toothpaste, corn, and wheat.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is married with three children, and lives in Tiribe Mombasa, the coastal city of Kenya.

Masudi works as a retail shop dealer to earn a living and has had this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more stocks of food for the festive season of Christmas. 

Masudi has been a member of Yehu for 5 years. In the future, Masudi hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en: Mwero is taking out another Kiva loan of 10,000 KES for Christmas celebrations. With the loan he plans to purchase bales of clothes and stocks of food for the family. He gives thanks to Kiva lenders for the opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and stocks of food for the family.

loans.name: Nimatao

texts.en:
Nimatao is from Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She’s married and has one child. Tiribe is a place noted for being very commercially productive. 

Nimatao is a very hardworking, responsible person. Her economic activity for the last 19 years has been selling seafood. The business consists of buying and selling seafood, and she does it both from place-to-place and in a local market. 

Nimatao has worked with Yehu Microfinance previously and has been responsible with her payments, making them on time as scheduled. She needs financing to invest in working capital to stock her business. Nimatao is grateful for the support provided by Kiva lenders to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Ohoud

texts.en:
Ohoud is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured in the location of their new house.

Ohoud is a 22-year-old young woman; she is married and has no children yet. Ohoud's husband is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Ohoud wants to share with her husband in completing building their new house, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies, such as cement, construction bricks, wood and iron.

This will help to complete building the house and enable Ohoud and her husband to live in their new house soon.

loans.use: To purchase necessary construction supplies to complete building the house.

loans.name: Mwanapazia

texts.en:
Mwanapazia is a resident of Tiribe, Mombasa. She is married, with seven children all in school. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses which include school fees.

Mwanapazia operates a small kiosk. She sells home consumables in her shop. She buys at wholesale and sells at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 Kenyan Shilling loan to help her expand the business by purchasing maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: by purchasing maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman living with her husband and five children. She manages two businesses, a charcoal stall and a khanga (women's cloth wrap) business. She works very hard to give her kids access to a high quality education.

Her store has been open for 6 years now, and has become the main source of income for her family. Through the busy store and business, she has gotten to know her neighbors much better, which in turn has grown her customer base.

Her store mainly sells khanga and charcoal. She wants to increase the variety of products she can offer to her customers, and also wants to further stock her business, since the demand for khangas is on the rise. Her future plans include expanding her business. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase bales of khanga and sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict, lives in Tiribe, Mombasa and is a single man. He has managed to put up a structure for selling fruits after many years of work. Driven to get ahead he has decided to expand his stall and so he is approaching Yehu for a loan. He shows a great interest in his work, performing the heavy work with charisma and joy, and manages to capture customers, making this a busy business.

They are in a season which the business sees an increase in sales, and therefore he wants to replenish his business with basic necessities. In addition, the year end festivities bring the sale of Christmas consumables whose gain is beneficial for his business.

He is grateful for the help you grant.

loans.use: purchase sacks of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a sole proprietor businessman who operates a butchery in a rural setting. His customers are mainly neighbors and passersby. He has been in this business for ten years and earns an income of 9,000 KES per month.

Joseph is married and together, he and his wife are blessed with two children; both of whom attend school. His wife is a farmer and this adds to the family income. Joseph was introduced to YEHU by an existing client; he has no history with any other MFI. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from YEHU, with which he intends to buy more goats and cows for more meat to sell in his butchery.

His major aim is to firmly establish his business and see his children get a better education in future.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows for more meat to sell in his butchery.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is taking out another Kiva loan of 15,000 KES to boost her retail shop business as she anticipates an increase in demand during this festive season. With the loan she intends to buy a greater variety of foods and groceries, looking to get better prices by buying in bulk. In this way, she can be more competitive in her pricing, and increase the stock available for sale.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of foods and groceries

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is taking out another Kiva loan of 10,000 KES to boost his clothes selling business as he anticipates an increase in demand during this festive season. With the loan, he plans to purchase shirts, skirts, and shorts as well as shoes and sandals due to increase in demand. In this way he will be able to increase sales at year end, a time when clothing and footwear are in great demand.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, skirts, and shorts as well as shoes and sandals

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a divorced woman who lives with her two children. She runs an agricultural business. Tabitha is involved in a poultry raising business, selling chickens locally. Tabitha is a very hardworking woman and has a wealth of experience in her business. She requested a loan to purchase feed for the poultry. After buying the feed, she will fatten her poultry properly and sell the birds at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Tabitha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the poultry.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with seven children living in Tiribe, Kenya. After realizing that the wages she used to earn as a casual laborer could not help her provide the basics to her family, she decided to venture into a firewood business five years ago.

Like most good mothers, she dreams of educating her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification, while her business plan is to venture into solar trade since it is not harmful to the environment. She has challenges of inadequate capital and customers who do not pay on time.

Mwanasha intends to use the loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman who lives in the village of Tiribe in the region of Kenya. She has four children; all are currently in school. For the past five years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, selling paraffin.

To help expand her business, Mwanaidi has requested a loan of 10,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) from Yehu Microfinance Trust. The loan will be used to buy more paraffin at a wholesale price and to resell at a low price to attract more customers. This will help Mwanaidi to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and their medical bills. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more paraffin.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and a mother of two children. She has sold scrap metals for 24 years. 

Agnes started her own business and is thankful for what she has.  She likes her work a lot and has broad experience.  This is Agnes's third cycle borrowing from YEHU MIRCROFINANCE.  She says the previous loans helped her support her business and increase her income.

Agnes hopes to continue expanding her business, to remain capable of raising her children in a suitable manner, and to provide them with the best education ever.  Today she is applying for a loan in order to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman living in Tiribe, Kenya.  She started with a retail shop and raised enough money to start a clothing shop 11 years ago. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal customers.

Her personal goals are to educate her children and to own a boutique.

Eunice needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a divorced woman and lives in the Tiribe region of Kenya.  For the past 13 years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells products such as maize.

To help expand her business, Chizi has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of maize to resell, and will help her to generate greater profits. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business in town.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani lives in Tiribe, a city of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children who are in school and living with them.

Imani has been running a shop since 2001, where she sews and sells school uniforms and African suits. She started this business with a little money given to her by her sister, and learned this way of selling from her friends.

She is requesting a loan to buy more tailoring materials and cloth for her business. She enjoys how her business makes her popular, and she makes more profit, especially during school and Christmas season. The problem that she faces is a small amount of commodities. Because she has more customers, she plans to expand her business even more and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials and cloth for her business.

loans.name: Muhache

texts.en:
Muhache sells food; she prepares delicious regional dishes.  Customers are drawn to her stand by the unique aroma and delicious flavor of her home-cooked meals. She sells on the sidewalk by her house located in an area with a large number of passersby of all types of people. 

Although she only works during the day, she generates a good income.  Muhache’s been in this line of work for about nine years, because even as a little girl she helped her mother in the kitchen to prepare meals; she was also a street food vendor. 

This business has provided her with the money needed to feed her four children and pay for their schooling, but she feels that her expenses will rise later on and she will need money. 

This is why she wants to open a restaurant at home so she can sell her delicious dishes more comfortably every day; she continues to seek a way to increase her income.

She will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients and some supplies needed to prepare her dishes and will also invest in building materials to set up a small space to tend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, some supplies and building materials.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has five children, all of whom attend school.  For the past five years, Rehema has worked hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil.

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes from Yehu Microfinance Trust to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers.  Rehema hopes to generate greater profits so she can pay for her children's school fees and medical bills. 

Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to build a big commercial house.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her shop's variety of products with seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another loan of Kes 30,000 to boost her motorcycle business. With the loan she plans to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance costs. In the future, Fatuma hopes to improve her services and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance cost for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Tiribe, Kenya. She is married and has six children. She and her husband provider for their family. 

Asha owns a small grocery store selling fruits and vegetables. She established her business four years ago.  Asha has built a good foundation of experience in this field, is well known in the surrounding area, and has an excellent reputation. 

Asha is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to renovate her shop and to increase her inventory of fruits and green vegetables.  She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her shop and to increase her inventory of fruits and green vegetables.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with four children living in Tiribe, Kenya. For three years, she has been selling clothes and farming to supplement her earnings.

She says her business is usually good during festive seasons and when students have broken off for holidays.  However, challenges Salama faces include inadequate money to meet the different tastes of her customers and high rental fees. 

As a good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the University level and to own a modern boutique that meets the quality of her customers. Salama is requesting for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married with five children. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. 

She operating a food vending business to make a living and Mwanaisha has been in business for fifteen years.  Each month she earns Kes 6,000. 

She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase ingredients of making doughnuts and dumplings and wheat flour to sell. 

Mwanaisha has been a member of Yehu Microfinance for two year.  In the future, a rising income will help her pay for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients of making doughnuts and dumplings and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Beqir

texts.en:
Beqir, forty-six years old, provides transportation services and uses his horse to transport goods and wood to his neighbors. 

Together with his wife, they have eight children and live in one of Kosovo's minority communities.  Bequir's business is the only source of income for his family and he is working hard to improve the lives of his wife and children. 

His horse trailer uses to transport the goods and wood is old and needs to be replaced with a newer, stronger one. 

Beqir is requesting a loan to buy a new trailer for the horse and to renovate his stable.  The loan will help him to continue his business and he is hoping to improve his family's life.  His goal is to give his children a better education and therefore a better future.  He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new trailer for the horse and to renovate his stable.

loans.name: Lendita

texts.en:
Lendita, 30, is married and has four children between the ages eleven and fifteen.  Her family lives in one of the minority communities of Kosovo under extremely poor conditions. 

Lendita ‘s husband works in a warehouse with a very low salary and provides the main source of income for his family.  Lendia’s family always feels cold and gets sick in winter due to the weather conditions because they have a serious problem with their home's windows and doors. The insulation and the construction is very poor and does not keep the cold out or the heat in. 

She will use a loan of 800 euros to buy new doors and windows for her house and some other basic things.  The loan will help her family to live a healthy and normal life.  She hopes in the future to provide a better life for her children.  She appreciate all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy new doors and windows for her house and some other basic things.

loans.name: Bint

texts.en:
Bint is a very hardworking person who is married with four children. Her store mainly sells coconuts. 

She wants this loan in order to be able to continue stocking her food kiosk with more coconuts, since the season in which she has more sales is getting close, and she wants to buy more coconuts for resale.

She again appreciates the opportunity that she is once more receiving, since in this way she will be able to grow and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is married with seven children, who are adults. She is a resident of Mombasa Kenya.

She has been operating a butcher shop for the past ten years. Her business consists of selling cow and goat meat. She has proven her sense of responsibility by making her payments in full and on time.

The objective of this loan is to have working capital and stock her business by purchasing a cow for meat sales so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season when sales increase. 

She is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders have given to developing countries such as Kenya and to people with limited resources, so they will have a decent means of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for meat sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local foodstuff for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la Ciudad de Encarnación se encuentra  en el 9º ciclo, todas ellas son mujeres luchadoras, madres de familia, que luchan por sus hijos, y por sus familiares, ya que desean salir adelante y darles lo mejor. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Miguela, ella tiene una cantina con cancha de vóley en su casa y también es docente jubilada. Al retirarse decidió seguir trabajando por su familia, y así monto su negocio, está saliendo adelante y lucha por ir creciendo día con día.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, ya que quiere poder surtir su cantina con ello, pues siempre tiene buena venta y quiere seguir dando una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is located in the "Ciudad de Encarnación" (City of Incarnation) and is in their 9th cycle. All of the women are fighters, mothers who fight for their children and their families, since they want to move forward and give them the best.

One of the members is Miguela. She has a snack bar with a volleyball court in her home. She is also a retired teacher. After retiring, she decided to continue working for her family, so she began her business. She is forging ahead and struggling to grow day by day.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy drinks, since she wants to be able to fill her snack bar. She always has good sales and wants to continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres de este grupo, ellas son de la ciudad de Luque, y se han unido con la razón de seguir luchando por sus hijos, el grupo lleva por nombre La Esperanza, ya que estas mujeres tienen las esperanzas puestas en este grupo.
La Sra. Karen se dedica a la venta de bebidas esta casada con el señor Sebastian, tienen 1 hijo, y esta a punto de recibir al próximo integrante de la familia. Ella solicitó el crédito  para la compra de bebidas, ya que quiere seguir vendiendo y trabajando para seguir creciendo. Karen tiene como meta surtir el negocio para formar una despensa o bodega ya que dedicarse a la venta de bebidas tiene una buena ganancia
texts.en:
There are 17 women in this group.  They are from the city of Luque and have come together to continue striving for their children.  The group is called La Esperanza [Hope], because these women have placed their hopes in this group.

Karen earns a living selling beverages.  She's married to Sebastián; they have one child and are about to welcome the next member of their family.

She requested the loan to buy beverages because she wants to continue selling and working to continue growing.

Karen's goal is to stock her business to form a general store or a grocery store because selling beverages earns good profits.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan, 35 years old, lives with his mother and sister in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His mother helps him to run his cattle breeding, pig and organic dairy production business, while his sister works at a private company. Bayarsaihan has also been running a taxi service since 2009.

He is requesting a loan of 3'000'000MNT to build a new warm barn and purchase forage for his farm. He is a hardworking, responsible and well-behaved man.

loans.use: to build a new warm barn for his farm and purchase forage for his farming business.

loans.name: Culantrillo Group

texts.es:
El comité Culantrillo es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 13 integrantes, donde cada una de ellas se dedica a una pequeña actividad por más pequeña que esta sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Una de las miembros es Noelia, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella es una persona muy buena para hacer los platillos que vende y es por eso que le va muy bien. Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante es que supera todo y está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Culantrillo committee is from the city of Concepción. It has 13 members, and each of them works as a small activity, however small it is. The women are very excited. The mutual help between them is constant and above all inspires them to keep fighting for their families.

One of the member is Noelia, who sells food. She is very good at making the dishes she sells and that is why it is going well for her. Thanks to her will to get ahead she is overcoming everything and growing.

She is asking for this loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients so she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and more ingredients.

loans.name: Villa Itaipu Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Villa Itaipu”  en honor a su Barrio, ya que todas están en busca de sus progresos y mejor condición de vida. El comité se encuentra en el Tercer Ciclo con 14 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Clarisa es parte de este grupo, ella es una muy buena comerciante, se dedica a la venta de sabanas de todo tipo y de muy buena calidad. Se ha hecho de buena clientela y esta saliendo adelante gracias a su sacrificio y a su esfuerzo. Ella desea poder seguir trabajando con su grupo, ya que les ayuda mucho a todas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de sabanas de variadas clases, para que así pueda seguir trabajando y dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
This committee is named  “Villa Itaipu”  in honor of its neighborhood. They are seeking progress and to improve their quality of life. The committee is in its third cycle with 14 members. Each has her own productive activity. They are very close and supportive of each other. 

Clarisa is a part of this group. She is a good merchant and sells sheets of every type and of very good quality. She has gained a good clientele and is getting ahead thanks to her sacrifice and hard work. She wants to keep working with her group since it helps all of them a lot. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying different types of sheets so she can keep working and giving her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy sheets to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa Rosa se conformó por 12 señoras con gran espíritu emprendedor. Las Mismas se unieron para poder unificar sus fuerzas y de esa forma lograr ayudar a sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Sara, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensa con todos los productos de primera necesidad que su vecindario necesita. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, ya que hoy día todo es más difícil.
Sara solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Committee is made up of 12 ladies with grand entrepreneurial spirits.  These ladies got together to help one another help their families.

One of the ladies, Sara, has a small grocery store with all the primary needs products that the neighborhood needs.  With great effort and sacrifice, she is getting ahead, now that everything these days is more difficult.

She is asking for this loan to buy drinks, milk products, breads, vegetables, meats, and other supplies to be able to continue providing her customers with the variety they are accustomed to.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en general, realiza sus ventas en su propia y también realiza repartos por la ciudad de Santa María.
Eusebia nos dice que por medio de su negocio ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para seguir teniendo una vida digna y sin privaciones. El deseo de Eusebia es poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a su familia, y es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y de verduras, para poder seguir trabajando y ofreciendo a sus clientes buenos productos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is from San Ignacio and has a fruits and vegetables business.  She sells from her home and also around the city of Santa Maria.

Eusebia says that she has been able to help her family through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations.  Eusebia wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this loan to invest in fruits and vegetables to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  están en el primer ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Maria, ella tiene su venta de verduras en una feria, está casada con el señor Lucio de profesión Albañil, tienen 2 hijos, por quienes la Sra. Maria y Lucio luchan, para poder darles una vida digna a sus hijos y una buena educación.
Maria solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, y así seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El grupo agradece por la ayuda que reciben pues les será muy útil.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and came about through contact with one of the foundation members.  The group is in its first cycle.

One of the members, Maria, sells vegetables at a fair.  She is married to Lucio, who works as a mason, and they have two children for whom she and Lucio struggle to be able to give them a dignified life and a good education.

Maria is asking for this loan to buy vegetables and continue helping her husband pay the household expenses.  The group is grateful for the help they receive because it is very helpful.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Inés” están en el  Quinto Ciclo  con   20  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable, aunque es un grupo muy numeroso se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo de todas.
Nancy es una de las miembros, ella es una muy buena peluquera, por medio de esta profesión está ayudando a su familia. La meta de Nancy es trabajar duro y por medio de ese esfuerzo seguir creciendo. Comenta que su grupo es muy unido y que se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Santa Inés” Committee is in its fifth cycle with 20 members.  This group is known in their neighborhood for being very united and responsible.  Even though it’s a large group, they help one another get ahead through everyone’s work.

Nancy is one of the members who is a good hair stylist and is helping her family through this profession.  Nancy’s goal is to work hard and continue growing through this effort.  She says that this group is very united and that they help one another. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in shampoo, rinses, scissors, and other supplies to be able to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Manduara Group

texts.es:
El comité “Manduara” se encuentra en el Quinto ciclo del programa, con el sacrificio de cada una de las miembros están saliendo adelante y creciendo, ya que todas ellas se ayudan.
Emilia, quien es parte de este grupo se dedica a la decoración de todo tipo de eventos. Ella se hace conocida ya que gracias a su buen trabajo está saliendo adelante. Tiene muy buena clientela quiere poder seguir creciendo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  telas, cintas, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee "Manduara" is currently on their fifth cycle of the program, with the sacrifice of each of the members they are getting ahead and growing, because they all help each other.
Emilia, who is part of this group works decorating all types of events.  She is getting to be known because thanks to her great work she is getting ahead.  She has very good customers and hopes to keep growing to be able to help her family.  She requests this loan to buy fabric, ribbon and other materials to be able to keep working and provide a good service to her clients.  She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are all getting.

loans.use: to buy fabric, ribbons and other materials.

loans.name: Bat

texts.en: Bat, 54 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a bus driver between Ulaanbaatar and Ulan-Ude, capital city of Buryatia, Russia, for a private company. Their four children work in Ulan-Ude, mainly in the construction industry. Bat herself formerly worked in boot factories but in 2009 she retired and has been receiving benefits. Also she cares for her daughter’s girls at home. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land and this summer they began to build an extension to their house. But due to their financial situation the family has not completed the extension and as winter comes to Mongolia, it will become a source of heat loss. So Bat is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to complete the extension. As a result, the family will be able to live in a warm and comfortable environment; furthermore they will burn less coal and thus contribute to efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to complete an extension to the family home

loans.name: Irum's Group

texts.en:
Irum is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, daughter and son. Her husband is doing a private job. Both of the children are students.

Irum is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. Since 2007 she has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Irum, as a member of a seven-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of living in her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. Irum and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

Note: In the picture Irum is holding a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old hard-working woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband and four sons. Her husband is a mason and one son runs his own welding shop.

Asia herself is an efficient tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine, but she can't due to financial constraints. Thus, as a member of a six-person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to sew more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. Asia will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.

Note: In the picture, Asia is holding a book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Rozi's Group

texts.en:
Rozi, resident of Rawalpindi (Pakistan), is a 56-year-old independent woman. She is a responsible mother of three sons and a daughter, all of them are students. Her husband is a school teacher. 

Rozi herself has been running her own clinic since 2006, and currently she is in need of purchasing some medicines for the clinic. For Rozi, as a member of a six person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income as well. Rozi dreams for the better future of her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Rozi holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase some medicines for her medical clinic.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de la Masica de San Juan Pueblo junto a su hijo y un sobrino.
Ella lleva 4 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos de confección de sabanas, cortinas, manteles y repara prendas de vestir de todo tipo. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y tiene buena clientela. Ella quiere mantener materiales en inventario y ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente, ya que le ha estado pidiendo al cliente que lleve todo y solo cobrar mano de obra, pero gana más poniendo los materiales ella. Por eso está solicitando un préstamo más para comprar telas y dar un mejor servicio al cliente y obtener mayor utilidad. Su sueño es que el negocio siga aumentando en clientes, que su hijo siga estudiando y que nunca le falte su alimento.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the town of Masica de San Juan Pueblo with her son and her nephew.
