For the past four years, María has been producing bed sheets, curtains, and tablecloths. She also mends all types of clothing. This business is her source of income and she has a good clientele. María wants to maintain materials in her inventory and offer better service to her customers. She currently asks that her customers bring her everything and then she only charges for labor, but she wants to earn more by having these materials. This is why she is requesting another loan for buying fabrics. As a result, she will be able to provide better service to her customers and generate more profit.

Her dreams include continuing to obtain more customers for her business, seeing her son continue with his studies, and not lacking anything to eat.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Grace Oyie

texts.en:
Grace Oyie  is married and has one child. She was able to complete her education to junior high school. Grace Oyie is a seamstress in Santrokofi, Hohoe, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Grace Oyie uses her income to pay for her junior brother’s school fees. 

Grace Oyie will use the loan to purchase linen and other sewing materials for her sewing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace Oyie plans to support her husband to pays their child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase linen and other sewing materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys sells drinks and provisions in Santrokofi, Hohoe Township. Gladys has completed middle school. She is married and has three children and two dependents. Her husband is a timber operator. Gladys has been selling drinks and provisions for the past 10 years. She is responsible for the financial needs of her two dependents and helps her husband feed the nuclear family. 

Her loan will be used to buy more mineral drinks, expand her provision business and introduce the selling of tomatoes. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to acquire a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy more mineral drinks, expand her provision business and introduce the selling of tomatoes.

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru: Мусо житель района Рудаки. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Мусо работает в средней сколе, она преподает первоклассникам. Мусо имеет высшее экономическое образование. Он не работает по профессии. Мусо предоставляет услугу. Он занимается ремонтом грузовых и легковых автомобилей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Мусо берет кредит для приобретения необходимых запчастей автомобилей.
texts.en:
Muso is a resident of the Rudaki region.  He is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  Muso's wife works in a school as a first grade teacher.  Muso has a higer education in economics, but he doesn't work in that profession.  He is in the business of repairing passenger and commercial vehicles.  He has been in this business for six years.  

Muso is taking out this loan to buy needed automobile repair parts.

loans.use: to buy needed automobile repair parts

loans.name: Saymuddin

texts.ru: Саймуддин проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 32 года. Он холост. У него среднее образование. Саймуддин более десяти лет предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров по району и по городу Душанбе. Саймуддин берет кредит для ремонта транспорта, чтобы продолжить свою работу.
texts.en: Saymuddin lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 32 years old and single.  He has a high school education.  He has been providing transportation services for more than ten years, within the city and district of Dushanbe.  He is taking a loan to repair his vehicle, so that he can continue to work.

loans.use: to repair his van.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Абдурахим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 26 лет. Он холост. Абдурахим трудолюбивый молодой человек. На сегодняшний день Абдурахим занимается строительными работами по найму. Он намерен заняться свои делом. 
Абдурахим берет кредит для закупа телят, дойной коровы и корма. Он намерен заняться своим делом у себя дома. Абдурахим создал условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он построил коровник. 
Абдурахим заранее благодарит Всех кто ему поможет.
texts.en:
Abdurahim lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is 26 years old and a bachelor.  Abdurahim is a hard working young man.  Nowadays he works as a builder for hire, but he is determined to get into business for himself.

Abdurahim is taking out this loan to buy calves, a milk cow, and feed.  Abdurahim's business is going to be based at home, where he has prepared the necessary conditions for raising large cattle.  He has built a cowshed.  

Abdurahim thanks in advance all those who help him.

loans.use: to buy calves, a milk cow, and feed

loans.name: Utkirjon

texts.ru: Уткиржон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Образование у Уткиржона среднее. Он ремонтирует новое помещение под магазин, которую сам построил. Уткиржон намерен открыть небольшой продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для приобретения продуктов питания, чтобы открыть собственный магазин и начать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Utkirjon lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is 26 years old and married.  He has a secondary-level education.  He is refitting a new commercial space, which he himself built, to be used as a store.  Utkirjon intends to open a modest-sized grocery store.  

He is taking out this loan to buy grocery items in oder to open his own store and start his business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Nusra

texts.en:
Nusra is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. Nusra is the only provider of the family.

Nusra is a hairdresser and works in her own house. She started her business in 2000. She has gained good experience in this field and she is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Nusra is requesting $1,800 loan to buy specialized equipment for her work. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy specialized equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Santoshi Maa Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en:
Santoshi Maa Mahila Samiti consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves share their problem and to solve their problems themselves.
. 
One of them is Basanti who was selected as the President of Santoshi Maa Mahila Samiti. The lady standing second from the left hand side wearing a yellow colored saree in the photo is Basanti. Basanti is 46 years old and is staying with her husband and her four children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 250,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Hojiamriddin

texts.ru:
Хочиамриддин житель района Шахритус. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Хочиамриддин живет с родителями. Их девять человек в семье. Хочиамриддин занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более двух лет. Хочиамриддин разводит скот дома. Он закупает телят, бычков и коз в дальнейшем для продажи. 
Хочиамриддин берет кредит для закупа телят и бычков с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Hojiamriddin is a resident of the Shahrituz region.  He is 20 years old and a bachelor living with his parents.  There are nine people in their family.  Hojiamriddin is in the animal husbandry business.  He has been in this business for over two years, and it is based at his home.  He buys up calves, bull-calves, and goats for future resale.

Hojiamriddin is taking out this loan to buy calves and bull-calves to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy calves and bulls

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Майсара 39 лет. Она очень старательная и целеустремленная женщина. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Она развелась 12 лет назад и с тех пор сама справляется с 5 детьми. С целью найти подходящею работу она несколько лет назад уехала в Российскую Федерацию. Она там работала и заработанные деньги она отправляла детям. Ее дети очень соскучились по ней и просили, чтобы она вернулась, так как кроме ее у детей никого нет. 
Она вернулась на родину  и начала искать работу, так как для обеспечения 5 детей требуется много денег. Она узнала от своих соседей о курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, который обучает женщин организовать свой бизнес. Она обучилась на этом тренинге и получила сертификат. Уже 6 месяцев как она владеет своим бизнесом. Она имеет свое кафе. Теперь она хочет развивать свой бизнес и для этого она хочет установить магнитофон и караоке. Таким образом, она будет привлекать больше клиентов. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки магнитофона и караоке, чтобы развивать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Maysara is 39 years old and a very diligent and goal-oriented woman.  She is divorced and has five children.  She divorced 12 years ago and since then she has been fending for her five children alone.  With an aim to finding suitable work, several years ago she left for the Russian Federation.  There she worked and sent money home to her children.  Her children missed her very much and asked her to come home, because they didn't have anyone besides her.  

Maysara returned to her homeland and started to look for work since caring for five children takes a lot of money.  She learned from her neighbors about a course called "Attain Success," which is put on by the Association of Business Women and teaches women how to start their own businesses.  Maysara went through this training and got her graduation certificate.  She has owned her own business for six months now.  She owns a cafe.  Now, she wants to develop her business by installing an audio recorder and karaoke machine to attract more customers.  Using her profits, Maysara plans to provide her children with good educations and calorie-rich foods.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni (TJS) for the purchase for an audio recorder and karaoke machine in order to develop her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an audio recorder and karaoke machine for her new business

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Адолат жительница района Шахритус. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Адолат на протяжении шести лет занимается выращиванием овощей и бахчевых культур. У нее недалеко от дома имеется участок земли, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. 
Адолат берет кредит для посева овощей. Она в основном выращивает овощи для продажи.
texts.en:
Adolat is a resident of the Shahrituz region.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband breeds cattle. For six years Adolat has been in business growing vegetables, melons and gourds.  She has a plot of land not far from their home where she does her farming.  

Adolat is taking out this loan for planting vegetables.  She primarily grows vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy seed

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Тошпулот, работает в строительной бригаде и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Мунира  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей   женской одежды, так как этот тип бизнеса имеет большой спрос. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ  на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Munira is a very decent and hard working woman.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband, Toshpulot, earns a small salary working on a construction crew.  His salary isn't enough to provide the family with all the necessities.  Munira decided to help her husband for the well-being of the family.  With this goal, she studied in a course called "Attain Success," put on by the Association of Business Women, and received her graduation certificate.  She is now fully capable of opening her own business and being successful in her field.

Munira wants to open a women's clothing business since this type of business enjoys strong demand.  She plans to use the income from the business to improve their living conditions.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to buy an inventory of goods so she can start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cement and bricks for her husband's construction supplies business

loans.name: Khujam

texts.ru:
Хужам житель района Шахритус. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках за рубежом. Хужам занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит мелко - рогатый скот. В этой области Хужам четыре года. 
Хужам берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы заняться купле - продажей крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Khujam is a resident of the Shahrituz region.  He is 49 years old and married with six children.  His son went abroad for work.  Khujam is in the business of raising cattle.  He primarily raises small, horned cattle.  Khujam has been in this business for four years.  

Khujam is taking out this loan to buy large, horned cattle in order to be in the business of raising for sale both large and small, horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves

loans.name: Tawia

texts.en: Tawia sells food stuffs at Santrokofi, Hohoe, in Ghana. She was able to complete her education to junior high school and is a widow with one child. Tawia has been selling food stuffs since 2000 and she also introduced the selling of cloth to her business after she lost her husband. She is responsible for paying the school fees for her only daughter and catering for her elder sisters, who are old and not working. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of food stuffs for resale. She hopes to save her new profits to create a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed  is a petty trader who sells beans, gari and groundnut in Santrokofi, Hohoe Township. Mohammed has never been to school.  She is married with six children. Mohammed has been in the petty trading business for the past three years. She has been assisting her husband to cater for their children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of beans, maize and groundnut. She hopes to save her profit in order to get more working capital so that she can travel to Tamale by herself to buy in bulk and retail.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, maize and groundnut.

loans.name: Koudjegua

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 29ans, Koudjegua est  célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfants en charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits de premières nécessités. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, Il a loué une boutique et se fait aidé par une personne. Vu que les demandes deviennent de plus en plus importantes, il fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale pour revendre et tirer des profits.  Il veut à l’avenir, vendre en gros et assurer les besoins primaires de sa future famille.
texts.en: Koudjegua is a young man of 29.  He is single and doesn't yet have any children.  In order to cover his needs, he sells basic household groceries.  With the aim of better responding to his customers' needs, he rented a store and has another person help him.  Given that his customers are demanding more and more, he is taking out his first loan from WAGES to buy general food products to re-sell and make profits from.  In the future, he would like to sell wholesale and cover the basic needs of his future family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Adjoko

texts.fr: A  la fin de son apprentissage, madame Adjoko âgée de 41ans a ouvert son atelier de couture dans lequel il coud des habits à ses clients.  Elle confectionne des rideaux pour revendre et a une ancienneté de 17ans. Trois personnes lui prêtent main forte pour l’avancement de son projet. Afin d’acheter des tissus pour la confection des rideaux, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer le minimum vital de la famille. Il est à préciser qu’elle est mère de 02 enfants dont 01 seul est scolarisé. Ils ont respectivement 23 et 18ans.
texts.en:
At the end of her apprenticeship, 41-year-old Adjoko opened a sewing workshop where she sews items for customers.  She makes curtains to re-sell and has been in this business for 17 years.  Three additional people help her to carry out her work more quickly.

In order to buy fabric for making curtains, Adjoko is requesting her second loan from WAGES.  She would like to re-invest in her business and guarantee the bare minimum for her family.  Adjoko is the mother of two children, only one of whom is in school.  They are 23 and 18 years old.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making curtains

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Rose  fait partie du groupe Kwizera  et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a  30 ans et est mariée à  Arthémon, un commerçant.  Ensemble, Ils ont  2 enfants   dont  1 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de haricot et de poules  depuis 8 ans. 

Elle  est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et beaucoup de poules   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Kwizera group and lives in Gitega.  She is 30 years old and married to Arthémon, who is a trader.  The couple have two children, one of whom is in school.

Rose has been selling beans and hens for 8 years.  This is her second loan from Turame.  With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital so that she can buy a large quantity of beans and a lot of hens to re-sell.  This will make her more money.

In the near future, Rose would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase her capital so that she can buy a large quantity of beans and hens to re-sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a second hand clothes seller who hawks her wares at Santrokofi, Hohoe, in Ghana. Dorothy has a primary school level education. She has lost her husband and is now a single mother to her six children. She has been selling second hand clothes for a living for the past 16 years and is responsible for all the financial responsibilities of her children. Her loan will be used to introduce towels and bedspreads to her business. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business so that she can make more income for the upkeep of her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand towels and bedspreads to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells cosmetic in Ahado, Hohoe, near the main Hohoe station. Samuel has completed school to middle level. He is married and has two children. His wife is a petty trader. Samuel has been selling cosmetics for ten years and he is responsible for his nuclear family and parents. His loan will be used to buy perfumes, pomade/cream and deodorant to increase profit. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to further expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, pomade/cream and deodorant for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes Esenam

texts.en: Agnes Esenam is a petty trader who deals in hair extensions in Ahado, Hohoe.  Agnes has completed schooling to tertiary level.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is also a petty trader. Agnes started selling hair extensions in 2002 to support her education and is still selling them. She assists her husband with their children’s school material. Her loan will be used to buy more hair extension products. She hopes to save her business's new profits to help pay her children’s school fees and give them a better education.

loans.use: to buy more hair extension products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine, and sugar to enable her bake in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 1/4 of a box of sugar, 1/4 of a box of couscous, 2 dozen boxes of matches, 8 pairs of shoes, 1/4 of a box of mayonnaise and 1 dozen boxes of toothpaste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paddy rice for processing and then resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 24 years old and from Gaza. Since 2010 he has owned an educational center for improving students' learning of the school curriculum. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a photocopier and some furniture for the center. He hopes that this loan will increase the number of clients/students and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and some furniture for the center

loans.name: Tahirou

texts.fr:
Né en 1975 à Sikasso Monsieur Tahirou est marié et père de 3 enfants résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Tahirou n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment à l’achat-vente des carburants (Essence, Gasoil, Pétrole lampant) depuis plus d’une année. Monsieur Tahirou dispose d’un point de vente de carburant au bord de la grande famille traditionnelle qui marche à merveille et il est très apprécié par sa clientèle. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de peu de moyens dont il dispose, il se voit incapable de satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte. Ainsi, il intégra l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt pour relancer son activité. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de la fidéliser.
Avec ce présent prêt, il compte acheter 6 bidons de 20 litres d’Essence, 8 bidons de 20 litres de Gasoils à la pompe ici à Sikasso, afin de les revendre en détail à une clientèle disposant généralement des engins à deux roues et de véhicules.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA. Les revenus qu’il découlera de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son prêt et faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Tahirou was born in 1975 in Sikasso.  He is married and has three children.  They live in a large, traditional family in Kaboïla I, a popular neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Tahirou didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  He started buying and selling items at a young age.  For more than a year he has been buying and selling fuel (gas, diesel, lamp oil).  Tahirou has a sales location which is doing very well and he is very well liked by his customers.  Given the lack of resources, he sees himself as being unable to meet his customer demand which is continually growing.  For this reason, he joined Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and his first loan will be used to boost his business.  This will allow him to better satisfy his customer demand and increase customer loyalty.

Tahirou will use this loan to buy six 20-liter containers of gas and eight 20-liter containers of diesel at the pump here in Sikasso in order to sell them retail to a customer base who mainly own two-wheeled vehicles.

With this loan, Tahirou plans to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs.  The income he makes from this business will allow him to repay his loan and meet his family's needs.  He will invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Amu

texts.en:
Amu is married and had no child. He was able to complete schooling through senior high school. Amu sells agro chemicals at Ve- Agbome, Hohoe, and he has been doing this since 2010. His wife is a ward assistant. 

Amu uses his income to expand the agro business. Amu will use the loan to purchase more agro inputs for resale to the farmers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Amu plans to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more agro inputs for resale to the farmers.

loans.name: Yatoufa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1955 à Nèbabougou Préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur  Yatoufa est polygame avec deux épouses et père de neuf enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yatoufa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié il y’a environ six années aux activités de vente de bois de construction qu’il achète dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 500 Planches de bois de constructions qui sera vendu à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice réalisé, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Yatoufa was born in 1955, in Nèbabougou, Sikasso.  Yatoufa is a polygamist.  He has two wives and nine children.  He lives with his two wives and children in Sanoubougou I, a popular neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Yatoufa did not have the opportunity to go to school and, after having run a number of businesses without much success, he started selling timber around six years ago.  He buys his timber in neighboring areas.  With the experience he has in his field, he has built up a strong reputation and receives a lot of orders.  However, he lacks the resources he needs to satisfy his customers' needs.  For this reason, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program.  This is his third loan and he will use it to increase his working capital so that he can better respond to his customers' demands.  He repaid his previous loans on time and in full.

This third loan will allow Yatoufa to buy 500 planks of wood which he will sell to a wide range of people.  He plans to make a monthly profit of 175,000 francs.  He plans to use the profits he makes to cover his main expenses and those of his family.  He will also pay the interest on his loan and invest the remainder in his main business.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 1/2 a box of canned tomatoes, 2 boxes of creams, 1/4 of a box of matches and 12 bags of cotton wool

loans.name: Mariami

texts.en:
Mariami lives in the village of Nasaguri, near Georgia's capital city. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law, and an infant grandchild. The main source of income for the family is an agricultural business - a small poultry farm. In addition, Mariami works as a nurse and gets a small monthly salary. Her son and husband are employed by a private construction company as workers and they help the family financially as well, but the total income is hardly enough for food for the five of them. 

Mariami and her husband have decided to start a new business as their existing income isn't enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor. Her loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to such credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers”. With the loan, Mariami will purchase a car, and her husband will become a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. They will have enough income to access general credit when the need arises.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi

loans.name: Mouder

texts.en:
Mouder is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Mouder is the only provider for the family.

Mouder is a carpenter. He established his business in 2010 and now he has an employee. He has built good experience in this field and he is becoming wellknown in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a food vendor at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe. Regina has been to school but ended at the middle school level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Regina has been cooking and selling in her locality for the past 11 years. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs, a carton of tinned tomatoes, a bag of rice and a gallon of oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to sew new school uniforms for her children and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, a carton of tinned tomatoes, a bag of rice and a gallon of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair dressing equipment for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking utensils.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussein is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Hussein is the only provider for the family. He is a butcher. He established his business in 2007 and has built up good experience in this field. He has an excellent reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to make an external ceiling, buy a motor generator and 2 new freezers. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to make an external ceiling, buy a motor generator and 2 new freezers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bag of sugar, a box of soap, and cartons of tin fish for her store.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 34 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has 4 children.

He has owned a shop selling shoes for men and women since 2005. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more shoes for the shop. Through this loan, the displayed shoes will increase and thus the income will improve to provide his family with a better education and life.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for the shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single young man. He lives in Khan Younis in a small house. 

For the past three years, Mohammad has had a cosmetics store which contains beauty products, perfumes and other cosmetics products. This store is a very successful project and earns a pretty good income, but some times it needs more liquidity to buy more products.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Mohammad to buy more products for his store, which will increase his sales and therefore increase his income positively. This will ensure Mohammad a better future. 

Mohammad appears in the photo. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending page: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy more products for his shop to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food spices and introduce the selling of oil, rice and tin (canned) tomatoes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and has one child. Khaled is the only provider of the family. He owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, snacks, fruits and vegetables. He established his business in 2010, and now he has an employee. He has built up good experience in this field, and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $1,800 to buy two new refrigerators and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: 03-5-22-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant, selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children. Liên lives with her 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2009, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 4 loans. She is the group leader of the 03-05-22-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She is requesting a loan to purchase beer, soft drinks and fruit to resell. 

In the future, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel on vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soft drinks and fruit to resell.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is from Iraq and is 22 years old and single. He lives with six family members, two of whom are employed. He owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, other dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now employs another staff member. 

Ahmed has built up good experience in this field and he is now well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to make a display window, build an external ceiling and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window, build an external ceiling and to install a rolling shutter in his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new jewellery, panties and more baby clothes.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 38-year-old Iraqi, who is married and has five children, two of whom are employed. He owns an internet café that he established in 2011. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Salah is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and a display window in his cafe, as well as to buy a new motor generator. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and a display window in his cafe, as well as to buy a new motor generator

loans.name: 09.03.04 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngà is 39, a married mother of two and lives in in Thanh Hoa city, Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam. She has a general store and is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as candy, biscuits, milk and sugar. She is the group leader of the 09.03.04 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

This is Ngà's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women, but she has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital. With her profits, she hopes for her store to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to succeed in school.

loans.use: to purchae candy, biscuit, milk, sugar...to resell .

loans.name: 03-01-04-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lài is a 36-year-old married mother of two who lives in Thanh Hoa city, Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam. She operates a food stall that sells snacks and is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make pork roll. She has been involved in this business for five years and the main hardship she faces is a lack of capital. She is the group leader of the 03-01-04-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

This is Lài's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. With her increased profits, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to have sustained success.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make pork rolls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Belle-Dame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Belle-dame, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Wakoro, chef lieu de commune, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers de boutique, de condiments, de légumes, de tubercules et font la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Belle-dame sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente MINATA, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 20kg de sucre, du riz, 1 carton de thé avec les revendeurs de Nangola  et qui seront revendus sur place aux clients du village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The Belle-dame (Beautiful woman) group is made up of married women, on average aged 36 years, with three children, and all living in traditional extended families in the city of Wakoro, administrative center of the commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through ties of family, neighbors, and friendship. They do business selling various shop items, condiments, vegetables, tubers, and prepared food.
The women of the Belle-dame group are on their fifth loan.
The customer Minata, the first person on the right in the row of seated people, counts on buying 20kg of sugar, rice, and one box of tea from the resellers in Nangola, which will be resold to customers in the village.
She envisages making an average monthly profit of 20,000XOF, which will be used for her family's needs, with a part reinvested in her business selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and tea.

loans.name: Fattah

texts.en:
Fattah is a 56-year-old Iraqi who is married with three children. He is the only provider for his family and now owns three restaurants, the first of which he established in 2011. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Fattah is requesting a $2,000 loan to renovate his restaurant. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant

loans.name: 09.01.12 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Minh is 57 years old and she is married with 3 children. Minh's children are grown up so she lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital. Minh is the group leader of the 09.01.12 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle for resale. This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for resell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées,  ont en moyenne 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Wakoro, chef lieu de commune, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de légumes, de tubercules et font la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés
La cliente SATA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter chaque semaine 5 kg d’oignon, 2kg de sel, une boite de tomate concentrée qui seront vendus aux clients du village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women on average aged 32 years, with five children, and all living in traditional extended families in the city of Wakoro, the administrative center of the commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through ties of family, neighbors, and friendship. They do business selling condiments, vegetables, tubers, and prepared food.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their third group loan and their two previous loans have been repaid in full.
The customer Sata, the second person on the left in the row of standing group members, counts on buying 5 kg of onions, 2kg of salt, and a box of tomato paste each week, which she will sell to customers in the village.
She envisages making an average monthly profit of 12,500XOF which she will use for her family's needs, reinvesting a part into her condiment selling business.

loans.use: to buy onions, salt, and tomato paste.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Wakoro, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de pâte d’arachide, de fruits, de légumes et font la restauration.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Benkan sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                
La cliente ARAMATOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter deux sacs de 100Kg d’arachide avec les revendeurs de Nangola et sur place pour ensuite transformer en pâte d’arachide destinée aux clients du village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of married women on the average aged 32 years, with four children, and all living in traditional extended families in the city of Wakoro in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family ties, neighbors, and friendship. They do business selling groundnut paste, fruits, vegetables, and preparing and selling food.
The women of the Benkan group are on their fourth group loan.
The customer Aramatou, the second person on the left in the row standing up, counts on buying two 100kg bags of groundnuts from the resellers in Nangola and in town to then make them into groundnut paste for customers in the village.
She envisages making an average monthly profit of 15,000XOF which will be used for her family's needs, with a portion reinvested in her groundnut paste business.

loans.use: to buy groudnuts.

loans.name: 09.02.03 - Phú Sơn3 Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 47 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Her children are grown up so she lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a retail business of selling in her general store. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy, milk and sugar for resale.

Ngân is the group leader of the 09.02.03 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Ngân hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy, milk and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is into photography in his community at Ve- Agbome, Hohoe. Samuel has received education to the senior high level. He is a single young man. He has been into photography since he completed senior high school. He planned to do this job so he could get money and get back to school. He is responsible for all his financial needs. His loan will be used to buy a modern camera and an instant printer so he can make more profit. He hopes to save his profits and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy a modern camera and an instant printer.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 42 years old and lives in Margibi County, one of the rubber-producing areas in Liberia. She is married and has five children between 14 and 20 years old who are in school and live at home.

For the past 15 years, she has been operating a little market table where she sells used clothes. She started this business with help from her mother, and she enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes to expand her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to expand her business,

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de femmes mariées, elles  ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Wakoro Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de volaille et font la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire 
La cliente BASSAMA, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis, compte acheter 3sacs de tubercules avec les fournisseurs de Dioïla et de Nangola qui seront vendus sur place aux clients du village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de tubercules.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women. On average they are aged 37 years, with three children, and all live in traditional extended families in the city of Wakoro, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met each other through family ties, neighbors, and friendship. They do business selling tubers, fowl, and preparing and selling food.
The women of the Danaya group are on their fifth group loan.
The customer Bassama, the first person of the right in the seated row, counts on buying three bags of tubers from the sellers in Dioïla and Nangola which she will sell to customers in the village.
She envisages making an average monthly profit of 20,000XOF which she will use for her family's needs, reinvesting a portion into her tuber selling business.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kolaban est composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Wakoro, chef lieu de commune, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de la volaille, de condiments, du savon, des fruits et légumes.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kolaban sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire 
La cliente MAKORO, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter une dizaine de volaille et des condiments avec les revendeurs de la place, ces produits sont vendus aux clients du village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de vente de volaille et de condiments.
texts.en:
The Kolaban group is made up of married and widowed women. On average, they are aged 36 years, with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in the city of Wakoro, the administrative center of the commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family ties, neighbors, and friendship.
The customer Makoro, the second person from the left in the row standing up, counts on buying a dozen fowl and condiments from the resellers in the area, and selling these products to customers in the village.
She envisages making a monthly profit of 15,000XOF which she'll use for her family's needs, reinvesting a portion in her business selling poultry and condiments.

loans.use: to buy fowl and condiments.

loans.name: Mawusi

texts.en: Mawusi is a married woman and has 3 children. She was able to complete middle school. Mawusi is fish seller at Akpafu, Hohoe, a job which she has done for the past 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Mawusi uses her income to pay for all the financial needs of the home because her husband has been sick for about 3 years now. Mawusi will use the loan to purchase different types of fish to sell in her neighboring communities. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mawusi plans to save for her family's upkeep.

loans.use: to purchase different types of fish to sell.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia is married with two children. She has received schooling but was able to complete only middle school. Portia sells secondhand clothes and fried fish as well at Akpafu, Hohoe. She has done this business for the past two years. Her husband is a farmer. Portia uses her income to buy school materials for her elder son, who is in senior high school. Portia will use this loan to purchase and introduce materials, tablecloths and towels to her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Portia intended to increase her working capital in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase and introduce tablecloths and tables to her shop.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is a petty trader who deals in the sales of paddy rice at Ve- Agbome, Hohoe. She has received education to the Middle school level. She is single but has four children. Ellen has been selling paddy rice for two years now. She is responsible for the financial and emotional needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy paddy rice, not only from her locality, but other rice farming communities in her area. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give better education to her children and provide the necessary balanced diet.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice not only from her locality but other rice farming communities.

loans.name: Mariami

texts.en:
Mariami is 26 years old and lives in Telavi district with her husband and two infant children. Several times, Mariami has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by her husband working as an artisan locally. 

Mariami requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Mariami will purchase clothes in Capital city open market at wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Mariami, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha sells hair extensions and plastic bowls at Akpafu, Hohoe. She has completed Middle school. She is divorced and has four children. Agatha has been selling hair extensions and plastic bowls for 3 years now after her husband divorced her. She is responsible for the general financial needs of her children and herself. Her loan will be used expand her plastic bowl business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more hair extensions.

loans.use: to expand her plastic bowl business.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Battsengel, age 34, stays home taking care of their disabled child and the family. His son Ganhuu, age 9, goes to a local primary school, and his daughter Erdenetsetseg, age 5, is a disabled child and stays home with her mother. 

Davaasuren has been a herdsman for years, but he needed to move to the province center because of his child's health condition. He is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his new business as a cobbler. He is a hardworking, positive and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his new business as a cobbler.

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a 20-year-old single man from Jenin. He lives with his family in Jaba'a village. He is a very ambitious young man. He is looking to complete his studies and become employed. He dreams to build his own house and get married and have a family.

Amro's family earns a low income that does not cover all their expenses. Amro works in a restaurant to help support his family and to cover part of his studying expenses. He is studying in a local university specializing in Finance. 

He took an $800 USD loan from FATEN to cover his university installments. This loan will help him to complete his studies and ensure him a bright future. 

Amro is photographed here in the location of the university where he is studying.

loans.use: To pay his university installments.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow and has four children who depend on her for everything. She has received schooling to the middle level. Mercy is a food vendor who prepares banku to sell, a popular Ghanaian meal, and is also a petty trader located at Akpafu, Hohoe. 

Banku is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a whitish, smooth consistency paste. It’s usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish. She has done this business for 21 years now.

Mercy uses her income to buy paddy rice from rice farmers and sells at the peak season so she can make a profit and pay her son’s fees in senior high school. Mercy will use this loan to purchase cassava dough, frozen meat and fish. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save for the future of the children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava dough, frozen meat and fish.

loans.name: Angelica Mercedes

texts.es: Angélica Mercedes tiene 28 años de edad, es propietaria de una pulpería  ubicada en el área urbana del municipio de Villanueva departamento de Chinandega, el cual en esta zona las actividades más sobresalientes son la ganadería,  Agricultura y diversos sectores de comercio, en donde ella vende su producto de consumo diario como granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, aceite azúcar entre otros, ella realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Chinandega, ella con el crédito anterior que se le otorgo ha podido incrementar  más su inventario en el negocio surtiéndolo con diversidades de artículos. Actualmente ella solicita crédito más poder incrementar a un más su negocio, y así poder ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos del hogar a sus cliente.
texts.en: Angélica Mercedes is 28 and owns a small grocery store in the urban area of the Villanueva municipality, in the department of Chinandega. The most successful activities in this region are farming, livestock, and various businesses. Angélica Mercedes sells basic staples such as basic grains, candies, pop, oil, and sugar. She makes her sales in the city of Chinandega. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her inventory and stock her business with a diversity of items. She is now requesting a loan in order to be able to expand her business more and to thus be able to offer a greater variety of home products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, pop, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Sanga

texts.en: Sanga, 38, lives in the Kakata community with her friend and her two children, ages 4 and 6, who attend school. Sanga is a hard-working mother who has been selling fish for the past five years. She sells twelve hours a day, in order to provide for her children's needs. She is proud of her business because she earns a profit and is able to earn her own income. She sells snappers, cassava fish,and bonnie fish to meet her customers' demand. She learned to sell from her mother. Sanga started this business with the small amount of 10,000 Liberian dollars, and she uses a motorbike to transport her goods to her business area. Sanga commends the lenders for their support of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Tajy Poty,  actualmente se encuentran en el décimo primer ciclo, esta integrado por  15 mujeres quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades, buscando de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus familias.
Amada quien se dedica a la venta de carnes de cerdos, es parte de este grupo, ella tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre trae muy buenas carnes que ofrece a sus clientes. Comenta ella que gracias a los créditos y a las capacitaciones ha ido creciendo y mejorando mucho.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, con lo que podrá surtirse, ya que es en estas fechas que tiene muchos pedidos por las fiestas y quiere poder ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called Tajy Poty, which is now in it's tenth first cycle.  It is made up of 15 women who invest their loans in their respective activities, in this way seeking to increase their income and improve their quality of life and that of their families.  

Amada, who makes a living selling pork, is part of this group.  She has good customers because she always has good pork to offer them.  She says that thanks to the loans and to the training her business has been growing and improving a lot.  She asks for this loan to buy pork, which she can stock up since at this time of year she has many orders for parties and she wants to be able to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy pork to sell.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is married and has 3 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. For this reason, he began his own transportation business six years ago. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, and now his children are able to get a good education and the family's financial challenges are being solved little by little.

Jamshed is asking for a loan to repair his car so that he can provide better service to his customers. He hopes this will increase his income, allowing him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is from Iraq. He is 46 years old and married. Hakim is the only provider for his family.

Hakim owns a shop, and he specializes in selling spare parts for cars. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hakim is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the yearly rent on his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent on his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has eight children. She has received schooling but was not able to complete the middle-school level due to financial constraints. Gladys sells foodstuffs to the people of Akpafu, Hohoe, and neighboring areas. She has been in this business for the past 5 years in order to support her last child, who is in school. Her husband is a tailor by profession. Gladys uses her income to pay for her child’s school fees. 

Gladys will use the loan to buy more bananas and plantains from the local farmers and send them to the town for sales to the market women. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to save towards her old age.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and plantains from the local farmers

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is married and has four children. She received no basic education. Eunice is a petty trader who sells beans and groundnuts at Akpafu in Hohoe, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is involved in farming activities. Eunice uses her income to assist her husband in order to see to the general welfare of the family. Eunice will use the loan to purchase a bag of beans and a bag of groundnuts. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to save to help her husband support their household.

loans.use: to purchase beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 29-year-old married man. He lives in Rafah with his wife and two kids: one son and one daughter. Abdallah is employed with a low income that does not cover all of the family's needs. So, for the past four years, he has had a small grocery store. The grocery store is a very successful project and helps the family to somehow cover their needs. Abdallah needs some cash to buy more grocery products for his store, such as milk, rice, and canned food. 

Abdallah is requesting a $1500 USD youth loan from FATEN. This loan will help Abdallah to improve his store and hopefully increase his income. Abdallah appears in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata lives in Kakata town. She is 37 years old and has three children between the ages of 10 and 17 who are in school and live at home. For the past fourteen years, she has been selling dry goods such as palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice. She started this business by selling cold water. Aminata enjoys always being busy and that her business is going fast. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, rice, and other items for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of food and household items for her business

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 19 years old and from Bethlehem. He owns greenhouses for planting different kinds of vegetables. He has an experience of 12 years in this field and has owned his green houses since 2008.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy new water sprinklers and water pipes, and to repair some of the greenhouses. He hopes that this loan will help him diversify the vegetables planted and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy new water sprinklers and water pipes, and to repair some of his greenhouses.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 39 years old and lives in Margibi County, a location that is very good at producing rubber plantations. She is married and has an 8-year-old child who is in school and lives at home.

For the past seven years, she has been selling dishes (bowls, plates, spoons, cups) in the local market. One of the main challenges she  faces is the prices of dishes is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes  (bowls, plates, spoon, cups) for her business. 

Jenneh plans to build a house and attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes (bowls, plates, spoon, cups) for her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita, 49, is a widow and the mother of five children between the ages of 20 and 32. She lives in the Kakata community with three of her children who are currently in school. Her other two children are independent. Rita is hard-working and productive for her family. She stopped her education in the 12th grade, and she has been involved in this business for the past ten years. She sells sardines, butter, cooking oil, rice, toothpaste, washing soap, and many other items. She makes a profit from her business. She sells twelve hours a day and transports her goods by taxi or wheelbarrow. Rita appreciates the lenders for their support of her business. With the loan, she will purchase more butter, sardines, cooking oil, and bath soap to increase her sales. Her plan is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more food and household items for her business

loans.name: Karemeh

texts.en:
Karemeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Karemeh is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 9 children: 6 boys and 3 girls. The family lives in Rafah. Karemah's husband works in the public sector with a low income that does not cover all of the family's needs, especially the education expenses for the children. 

Karemeh is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover her children's education expenses. This loan will help the family to pay part of the university installments for Karemeh's daughter, who is specializing in Arts. Karemeh hopes that this loan will ensure a better future for her daughter and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yams in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is into the bakery business. She bakes pastries for selling at Akpafu, Hohoe. Hellen has completed middle school. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is into petty trading. 

Hellen has been frying and selling the doughnuts herself. She has been into the bakery business for 3 years now. She assists her husband with some financial responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour, a gallon of oil, and margarine so as to fry in large quantities to increase her profits. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a gallon of oil, and margarine for frying in large quantities.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a petty trader in Akpafu, Hohoe. She is married to a farmer and has three children. Patience has completed junior high school.

Patience has been a petty trader since 2010 when she realized that her husband's income could no longer support the whole family. She assists him in providing for the home. Patience will use her loan to buy cases of canned tomatoes and fruit drinks. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cases of canned tomatoes and fruit drinks

loans.name: Sanga

texts.en:
Sanga, 37, has been working hard with her business for the past six years. She is married and a mother of two children, ages 2 and 5, who are attending school. Sanga lives in the Kakata community that is noted mainly for producing rubber. 

Sanga sells pepper, rice, palm oil, Vita (juice drink), cooking oil, onions and many other items. She received the initial capital from her husband to start in this business. She transports her goods by means of taxi to her business area and sells from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Sanga makes a profit when she sells because she has a lot of customers and always has what her customers need. 

Sanga has requested this loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, Vita and palm oil for her business. Her future plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, Vita and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Mirzali

texts.en:
Mirzali is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three teenage children. He is a home-repair worker, but the main income of the family is from an agriculture business. For more than 21 years, he has run an agricultural business which includes cattle and milk cows, whose milk they use to make cheese and butter to sell. 

Mirzali is a very hard-working and responsible man. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. He will make repairs at his house himself. He needs a loan of 1,400 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). This will increase the family's moral sentiment and allow them to improve their living conditions. Mirzali is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make repairs at his house himself.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh lives in Kakata Town. 31, she stopped her education at grade 6. She is single and has a two-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Her boyfriend is a businessman. For three years now, she has been selling rice palm oil, sugar, flour and other items in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice palm oil, sugar, and flour for her business. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She is happy with her business because of the profits she makes every day. Her plan is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rice palm oil, sugar, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en: Yeghishe lives in Chiva village of Vayotc Dzor region with his wife and two sons. The family is involved in agriculture. They run a farm where peach, pear, apple and nut trees are grown. Yeghishe is engaged in cattle breeding as well. He keeps an ox, a cow and 7 chickens. As the family has to wait until spring to gather harvest and sell it, it is very difficult for them to cover their daily operational costs. Yeghishe has applied for this loan to expand his livestock. With the requested amount he will purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, the loan is very important for Yeghishe to have stable income during the winter.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jestine

texts.en:
Jestine is 32 years old and lives in Margibi County. She is married and her husband is a security guard. They have three children ages 9 to 15 years old. 

For the past five years, she has been operating a little shop where she sells red oil, rice, pepper, etc. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. 

Jestine is requesting a loan to purchase rice, red oil, pepper, and other items for her business. 

She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, red oil, pepper, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married and has two children with her husband, a petty trader. She has received schooling to the completion of junior high school. Since 2005, Nancy has been selling provisions in Akpafu, Hohoe Township, for a living and to support her husband. Nancy reinvests her income into her business. She will use this loan to purchase cases of canned milk and washing detergents. Nancy will use the new profits from her business to save towards its expansion.

loans.use: to purchase cases of canned milk and washing detergents

loans.name: Harrison Ford

texts.en:
Harrison Ford is a petty trader who has operated a provisions shop in Akpafu, Hohoe, since 2005 to assist with his family's financial needs. He is married and has two children. Harrison Ford uses his income to pay for utility bills and to run the home as a man. He was able to complete his education only to Junior High level.

Harrison Ford will use this loan to purchase cases of canned tomatoes, bags of rice and bottles of oil. He will use the new profits from his expanded business to save towards the future and for reestablishment of the business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of canned tomatoes, rice and oil

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenebileg is 46 years old lives with her husband and 2 children in their house in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Altanhuyag, age 50, is retired and helps his wife to run her small retail business in the local market. Her daughter Orlomsuren, age 22, is a junior student of the university and her son Tsegmid, age 17, is a senior student of the local secondary school. 

Mrs. Erdenebileg has been running her business of small grocery items since 1998 with a starting investment of 50,000 MNT and she has been running successfully since. She is now requesting 600,000 MNT to pay her daughter's dormitory fee and other school related items. She is a hardworking, neat and honest woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's dormitory fee and other school related items

loans.name: Otari

texts.en:
Otari is 56 years old. He lives in Kvareli District with his wife and grown son. Otari has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for his family business start-up without any success. His loan request has been rejected many times because of his low income and lack of experience in his new business. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm of 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold locally. Additionally, Otari owns a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown. Otari is also involved in a flour-trading business and gets monthly income. 

Otari is requesting a loan from Credo to re-start-up his family business which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to purchase pigs to start an animal husbandry business. He will put the pigs in a shed in the yard, raise them and will be able to sell piglets for a good price. Otari's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Otari's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  sells doughnuts at Brenu Akyimu near Elmina. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter.  

Ama has been in this business for three years. She uses her income to help her husband in paying their children's school frees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of  flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of  flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 45, stopped  her  education  in  the 10th  grade. She is married  with  two  children, 24 and 26, who are currently in school.  Mamie is a  hard-working  mother  who has been selling  dry meat for the past ten years. She sells bush meat like red deer and monkey  meat. She lives  in the Jacob  Town community and sells twelve hours a day. She makes a profit  when she sells, because she has a lot of customers, and she  transports  her goods by means of taxi to her business area. 

Mamie has requested a loan to purchase more bushmeat for the business. Her plan for the future is to became a big businesswoman and  build a decent house.
